FuncDef:
The l2tp calling-number-avp enable command adds attribute AVP22 to L2TP packets.
The undo l2tp calling-number-avp enable command removes attribute AVP22 from L2TP packets.
By default, L2TP packets carry the attribute AVP22.
ExtraInfo:
Attribute AVP22 indicates the number of the caller, which is an optional parameter of the ICRQ packet sent by the LAC (the device) to set up the L2TP session.
The l2tp calling-number-avp enable command controls whether the LAC adds attribute AVP22 to the ICRQ packet. Through attribute AVP22, the LNS can know the caller number.
